content:
Hey @Taylor Cramer and @boats --

I've been working on a summary comment that describes the overall state of async-await as I see it. I'd like your feedback both on its content and on thoughts of where to post. I was thinking of posting to my blog and cross-posting to internals + that locked thread.

In any case, I was also thinking that we need to take the following organizational steps:

  • Write-up the plans to fix each bug
  • Initiate some sort of labeling system to record the results of triage
    • For example, perhaps adding AsyncAwait-Blocker and AsyncAwait-NotBlocker labels would be a start, and tagging the issues as appropriate. In NLL, we found this scheme to ultimately be the best. (We might want more categories =)
  • Document our plans for fixing the blockers in comments on the thread
    • also, we need to be ready to mentor folks should they show up -- @Taylor Cramer I'd like to know how available you are for that.
I think we should also try to hold some kind of short "triage meeting", I'd like to be able to "invite folks" to it. This might be a time that we do some of this "blocker vs non-blocker" work.

Since I'm not hearing from you two, I think I'm just going to mark down Tuesday at 13:00 my time as an "initial meeting" for async-await to try and do some of this work. Meanwhile, I'll pencil in 12:00-13:00 as a time to get some of the prep work done. =)
Don't know how to join the 'office hours' meeting, but I'm on zulip at about the right time...
@Giles Cope :wave: it's not started yet =)
that's cool - was just checking I was kind of in the right place
